PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTiming.summary: NOTE Experimental The PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTiming interface is specified in the Long Animation Frames API and provides metrics on long animation frames (LoAFs) that occupy rendering and block other tasks from being executed.

PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTimingBlock.summary: NOTE Experimental The blockingDuration read-only property of the interface returns a indicating the total time in milliseconds for which the main thread was blocked from responding to high priority tasks, such as user input.

remarks.para:
-Long animation frame timing
-
-Optimize long tasks on web.dev (2024)

PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTimingFirst.summary: NOTE Experimental The firstUIEventTimestamp read-only property of the interface returns a indicating the time of the first UI event — such as a mouse or keyboard event — to be processed during the current animation frame. Note this timestamp can be before the start of this animation frame if there was a delay between the event happening and it being processed.

PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTimingStyle.summary: NOTE Experimental The styleAndLayoutStart read-only property of the interface returns a indicating the beginning of the time period spent in style and layout calculations for the current animation frame.

PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTimingScrip.summary: NOTE Experimental The scripts read-only property of the interface returns an array of objects.

remarks.para: Script attribution is provided only for scripts running in the main thread of a page, including same-origin <iframe>s. However, cross-origin <iframe>s, web workers, service workers, and extension code will not have script attribution in long animation frames, even if they impact the duration of one.

PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTimingRende.summary: NOTE Experimental The renderStart read-only property of the interface returns a indicating the start time of the rendering cycle, which includes callbacks, style and layout calculation, callbacks, and callbacks.

PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTimingToJSO.summary: NOTE Experimental The toJSON() method of the interface is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTiming object.
PerformanceLongAnimationFrameTimingToJSO.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
